title: Siddig Feana
subtitle:
According to UN records, Darfur refugees are estimated to be around five million displaced persons and refugees, as well as IDPs, refugees and displaced people in dam areas in the north.
Considering the suffering, frustration and negative discharge in the displacement and asylum pic.twitter.com/l9ooqxqfVt

title: Giles Duley
subtitle:
Deeply moving to see this photograph at @TheGalleryDMU
I made the image in 2015 of a baby moments after being born in Zaatari refugee camp. In those first seconds this Syrian baby was the youngest refugee; now he’s 4 & still living in the camp. What future lies in store for him? pic.twitter.com/Jj42HxBUzj

title: Real-Shirzad
subtitle:
“Afghan Girl.” Photographer Steve McCurry captured the iconic image of an Afghan refugee in Pakistan during the time of Soviet occupation in the 1980’s. The photograph was taken in 1984, but the woman, Sharbat Gula, was not identified until 2002. 

#Afghanistan #photographypic.twitter.com/UZDqiQe85O

title: Clare MacGillivray
subtitle:
#MyPalestinianSitty
Beautiful tributes to Palestinian grannies. My bairns had a cracker in my beloved mother in law Itaf. An inspirational Palestinian feminist activist. A refugee. A mighty, feisty woman with the biggest heart. She was loved immeasurably.
http://qudsnen.co/palestinian-grandmothers-trend-on-twitter-following-israels-ban-of-congresswomen/?fbclid=IwAR0O66NxY98FI2mKR9wC_beKifPhQ5u-NXtdzfsYUtgGZLUueCoQxtPHfpY …pic.twitter.com/vG5vDMBcGT

title: Jane Considine
subtitle: Well this woman (my mum) since retiring she volunteers at a refugee centre to help new families settle, has taken up floristry & now has a Grade 6 in Maths GCSE that is the same grade my daughter got today too. True empathic twinning. She is a bloody legend and true inspiration. pic.twitter.com/lhYwvQElsk
